results.title: Cetamolol: cardiovascular effects of a new cardioselective beta-adrenoceptor blocker possessing partial agonistic activity and lacking membrane-stabilizing activity.
results.text_hl: However, the beta-blocking effects of these two drugs predominated in the anesthetized closed-chest @SPECIES_9615 @@@dog@@@, conscious @SPECIES_9615 @@@dog@@@ and @SPECIES_9527 @@@monkey@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, which lack partial agonistic activity, produced cardiovascular @<m>DISEASE_Nephrosis_Lipoid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009402 @@@changes@@@ characteristic of this type of beta-blocker in the animal preparation in which they were tested.

citations.NLM: Beaulieu G, Grimes D, Muirhead C, Oshiro G. Cetamolol: cardiovascular effects of a new cardioselective beta-adrenoceptor blocker possessing partial agonistic activity and lacking membrane-stabilizing activity. Can J Physiol Pharmacol. 1984 Jun;62(6):610-6. PMID: 6146394
citations.BibTeX: @article{6146394, title={Cetamolol: cardiovascular effects of a new cardioselective beta-adrenoceptor blocker possessing partial agonistic activity and lacking membrane-stabilizing activity.}, author={Beaulieu G and Grimes D and Muirhead C and Oshiro G}, journal={Can J Physiol Pharmacol}, volume={62}, number={6}, pages={610-6}}

results.title: Symptomatic orthostasis with extended-release nifedipine and protease inhibitors.
results.text_hl: Subsequent administration of antiretroviral therapy containing @CHEMICAL_Ritonavir @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019438 @@@ritonavir@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Indinavir @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019469 @@@indinavir@@@ with extended-release @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ resulted in recurrence of his @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic symptoms@@@. Discontinuation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ dosage reduction by 50% were effective in managing his orthostatic @<m>DISEASE_Nephrosis_Lipoid</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009402 @@@changes@@@.

citations.NLM: Rossi DR, Rathbun RC, Slater LN. Symptomatic orthostasis with extended-release nifedipine and protease inhibitors. Pharmacotherapy. 2002 Oct;22(10):1312-6. PMID: 12389881
citations.BibTeX: @article{12389881, title={Symptomatic orthostasis with extended-release nifedipine and protease inhibitors.}, author={Rossi DR and Rathbun RC and Slater LN}, journal={Pharmacotherapy}, volume={22}, number={10}, pages={1312-6}}
